messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Thinking Sticks?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/23/01 10:26:43 PM, OZMOM504@AOL.COM writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/23/01 10:26:43 PM, OZMOM504@... writes:

<< Hi! I was wondering if anyone knew about a game a friend of mine told me
she
had heard about. She thinks someone made it up (as in not available in
stores) and that it sounded real interesting. Does anyone know about this
*game*? Does anyone know how to make one up? Thanks! :o) ~Nancy >>


It's sort of a game, sort of a tool to awaken awareness of the connections
between things so people can unschool, I made it up, it's not available in
stores, and it's described at http://expage.com/ThinkingSticks

They were first made for a workshop I did on thinking, at the Mindfull
conference a few years back. I'll have some with me at the HSC
Home=Education conference in Sacramento in August (
http://www.homeedconference.org/) but you can order them by mail. The box is
cute. The instructions are the best part. There are a couple of other
little surprise bits. The sticks are themselves pretty (all colors).

Please look!

http://expage.com/Thinking Sticks

http://www.homeedconference.org/


Sandra

messages.subject: Thinking Sticks?
messages.msgSnippet: Hi! I was wondering if anyone knew about a game a friend of mine told me she had heard about. She thinks someone made it up (as in not available in stores) and
messages.messageBody:
Hi! I was wondering if anyone knew about a game a friend of mine told me she
had heard about. She thinks someone made it up (as in not available in
stores) and that it sounded real interesting. Does anyone know about this
*game*? Does anyone know how to make one up? Thanks! :o) ~Nancy
